alert.note: Alert for San Joaquin (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 2:34PM PDT until April 05 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... San Joaquin River Near Vernalis affecting San Joaquin County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Joaquin River near Vernalis. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM PDT Monday the stage was 29.0 feet. - Forecast...Forecast to fluctuate near 29.0 FT thru early Wednesday afternoon. * Impact...Near 21.0 feet, Seepage begins into crop area outside of levees. Near 26.0 feet, Severe seepage occurs outside the levees. The area covered by seepage will increase as the river stage rises. Near 37.29 feet, Stages above 37.3 feet results in flooding outside the levees. Top of levee. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.0 feet on 01/06/1984. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php Tuesday afternoon at 245 PM PDT.
